chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Radley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow. 
Court will allow Electronic Monitoring after serving the first 90 days.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during term of probation.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Kohls Department Store.
Participate in any other counseling or assessment by the agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J. Radley
Current: 450 S Western Ave Apt B5, Waupaca, WI 54981   (Effective: 06-17-2015)
Prior: 450 S. Western Avenue B5, Waupaca, WI 54981

Defendant Robert J. Radley in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:37 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1 to a misdemeanor retail theft and another count of misdemeanor  retail theft.

Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 2 and 3

Count 1 and 3: impose/stay 180 days, 24 mo prob, costs, dna surcharge, no contact with co-defendant and Kohls, obtain counseling as recommneded, mtn ft emt
Count 2: $100 fine plus costs

Atty McFarland addresses the Court, only issue is with the no contact of co-defendant
State would agree to strike this condition of probation.

Atty McFarland concurs.
Defendant concurs.

 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Atty McFarland has received a copy of the amended information and waives reading.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Theft, party to the crime, repeat offender
Count 2: Operating After Revocation
Count 3: Misdemeanor Theft, party to the crime, repeat offender

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. There is no restitution request as items were all collected at the scene.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court believes the jail sentence is appropriate. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1: Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Court will allow electronic monitoring after serving the first 90 days
3 Days Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
To be paid during term of probation
Pay DNA Surcharge
To be paid during term of probation
No contact with Kohls  Department Store
Participate in any other counseling or assessment by the agent
Maintain full time employment

Count 2:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
3 Days Jail Credit
Huber granted for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Court will allow electronic monitoring after serving the first 90 days
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

11:22 AM Court calls case.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court has received the information.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Atty McFarland has received a copy of the information, waives reading.

Atty McFarland enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Parties will pretrial this case today.
